task_instruction: lift open green garbage can lid
task_summary: Robot perceives the green bin lid, approaches and aligns, grasps the lid edge, lifts along z to open it, verifies the bin is open, and retreats.

node_specs.description: Set a key/value on the blackboard for downstream nodes.
Checks if the target object is visible.
Actively scan to localize the target with a specified pattern.
Move to a pose vertically above the target by offset_z.
Approach the target and align within a tolerance.
Open gripper to the requested width.
Close gripper with specified force to secure the grasp.
Verify that the grasp is stable before lifting.
Move end-effector along an axis by a small distance.
Checks if the named container is open.
Back off from the workspace to a safe distance.

assumptions: The bin lid has a graspable edge or handle.
The robot base is already positioned within reach of the bin.
Scene is static during the sequence and lighting allows detection.
failure_modes: Lid not detected due to glare or occlusion
Grasp slips on smooth lid surface
recovery_strategy: Re-scan with spiral pattern if not visible
Reduce lift distance and re-grasp if unstable

local_annotations.event: Scene overview; green bin with lid in front-left; arm right of bin.
Arm begins approach toward lid region.
Arm closer and roughly above lid.
Contact and grasp on lid edge.
Lid more open; arm continues lifting.
Lid open state visible; arm starts to retreat.
